senses.de: To focus all your thoughts or efforts on a particular thing
senses.ex: I can't concentrate on my work with all that noise.

Tips.title: Distraction Avoidance
Tips.description: When concentrating, try to minimize distractions in your environment to improve focus.
Tips.example: She closed the door to concentrate on her reading.

Tips.title: Effort Intensification
Tips.description: Use 'concentrate' when describing intense effort put into a single activity or goal.
Tips.example: He needs to concentrate on finishing his essay by tonight.

Tips.title: Mental Commitment
Tips.description: 'Concentrate' often involves a firm mental commitment to a task or thought.
Tips.example: Can you concentrate on solving this problem for a moment?

senses.de: To become stronger by removing water or other substances
senses.ex: The fruit juice was concentrated by evaporation.

Tips.title: Reduction Process
Tips.description: In chemistry, concentrating involves reducing something, like liquid, to increase strength or purity.
Tips.example: By heating the mixture we can concentrate it into a thicker syrup.

Tips.title: Enhanced Potency
Tips.description: Use 'concentrate' to suggest that something is made more potent, pure, or rich in quality.
Tips.example: The concentrated cleaner works better than the diluted version.

Tips.title: Process Clarification
Tips.description: Clarify the process of concentrating, like evaporation or filtering, especially in technical contexts.
Tips.example: We concentrate the solution using evaporation under reduced pressure.

senses.de: To gather people or things into one place
senses.ex: The students were concentrated in the auditorium for the lecture.

Tips.title: Gathering Point
Tips.description: Use 'concentrate' to describe bringing things or people closer together in one location.
Tips.example: The charity concentrated its resources on the disaster-hit area.

Tips.title: Strategic Positioning
Tips.description: 'Concentrate' can mean strategically positioning for effectiveness, often used in military contexts.
Tips.example: The general ordered to concentrate the troops on the eastern front.

Tips.title: Focus Enhancement
Tips.description: Use 'concentrate' to indicate increasing the intensity or focus of efforts on a task or cause.
Tips.example: We must concentrate our efforts on the fundraising campaign.

senses.de: A substance that has undergone the process of becoming stronger
senses.ex: I added some water to the orange concentrate to make juice.

Tips.title: Stronger Flavor
Tips.description: In food, 'concentrate' means a stronger or more intense flavor as water or other substances are reduced.
Tips.example: Instead of fresh fruit, you can use fruit concentrate for the pie filling.

Tips.title: Dilution Requirement
Tips.description: A concentrate typically requires dilution before consumption or use to achieve the desired consistency.
Tips.example: Mix the concentrate with three parts water before drinking.

Attend.wordDefinition:
Attend means to be present at an event or activity. For example, you attend a concert or a class.

So, attending is about being physically present while concentrating is about paying attention and focusing on a specific task or activity.

Both words are applicable in different situations, such as attending a meeting or concentrating on a project at work.

It's important to attend events to be present and participate, but it's also important to concentrate to achieve your goals and objectives.

Centre.wordDefinition:
Centre refers to a physical point or location, whereas concentrate refers to the act of focusing one's attention or energy on a particular task or object.

For example, you can say that the town's main shopping centre is located in the middle of the city, or that the player needs to aim for the centre of the target.

Centre refers to a physical location while concentrate refers to a mental or emotional process of focusing one's energy or attention.

Dedicate.wordDefinition:
Dedicate means to commit oneself to a particular purpose or goal. It is applicable when you want to set aside time and effort for a particular cause or interest, like dedicating your time to volunteering or dedicating a book to someone.

Concentrate is about focusing attention and effort, while dedicate is about commitment and purpose.

Direct.wordDefinition:
Concentrate means to focus your attention or energy on a particular thing, while the word direct means to guide or instruct something or someone towards a specific goal or direction.

Direct is applicable when you need to give instructions or guide someone towards a particular goal or outcome, like directing a movie or guiding a friend through a difficult task.

Concentrate means to focus your own attention, while direct means to guide someone else's actions.

Engross.wordDefinition:
Engross means to completely involve your attention or emotions in something. This can be applicable when you're watching a movie that you really enjoy or reading a book that you can't put down or in any situation where you're completely absorbed in what you're doing.

So, while both words refer to paying attention, concentrate suggests a deliberate and intentional focus, while engross implies a more complete and immersive experience.

Focus.wordDefinition:
Concentrate means to give all your attention to one thing, to focus your mind on it. For example, when you're studying for a test, you need to concentrate on the material and not let other distractions get in the way.

Focus means to direct your attention to a specific thing or task. It is more about narrowing your attention to a particular aspect.

For example, a photographer might focus their lens on a specific subject within their photo.

Both words are applicable when you need to pay attention to something or complete a task, but concentrate emphasizes giving your full attention to one thing, while focus emphasizes narrowing your attention to a specific aspect.

Immerse.wordDefinition:
Immerse means to involve yourself deeply in an activity or situation, often to the point where you lose track of time or your surroundings.

Concentrate is about paying attention and focusing on one thing, while immerse is about becoming fully involved in an experience or activity.

Intensify.wordDefinition:
Intensify generally means making something stronger, more forceful, or more extreme. This could refer to emotions, such as intensifying feelings of love or anger, or physical sensations, such as intensifying pain or brightness.

Concentrate is applicable when you are trying to focus on a specific task or object, while intensify is applicable when you want to make something stronger or more extreme.

quotes.Text: When you see a person, do you just concentrate on their looks? It's just a first impression. Then there's someone who doesn't catch your eye immediately, but you talk to them and they become the most beautiful thing in the world. The greatest actors aren't what you would call beautiful sex symbols.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Brad Pitt

quotes.Text: What material success does is provide you with the ability to concentrate on other things that really matter. And that is being able to make a difference, not only in your own life, but in other people's lives.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.Text: In the concentration camps, we discovered this whole universe where everyone had his place. The killer came to kill, and the victims came to die.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Elie Wiesel

quotes.Text: It seems essential, in relationships and all tasks, that we concentrate only on what is most significant and important.
quotes.Title: Danish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.Text: Historically, the stuff of the universe goes on becoming concentrated into ever more organized forms of matter.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.Text: Complaining and arguing will not help. We are fully concentrating on the game against the Czechs.
quotes.Title: German Athlete
quotes.Name: Oliver Kahn

quotes.Text: I am full of fire and passion. I am not ready yet for great concentration and passion.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zane Grey

quotes.Text: For me, it's important to concentrate to the present and leave the past.
quotes.Title: Italian Coach
quotes.Name: Antonio Conte

quotes.Text: Concentrate, play your game, and don't be afraid to win.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Amy Alcott

quotes.Text: Concentration is one of the happiest things in my life.
quotes.Title: Japanese Writer
quotes.Name: Haruki Murakami
